Author(s): Rachel E. Morgan, Ph.D., and Grace Kena, BJS Statisticians
Percent of firearm victimizations reported to police

Note: Includes violent incidents and victimizations in which the offender had, showed, or used a firearm. An incident is a specific criminal act involving one or more victims or victimizations, while a victimization refers to each person or household involved in the incident. See appendix table 6 for standard errors.
Source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, National Crime Victimization Survey, 2016.
